attributes.action: We are individuals not 'herd'!UK don't sacrifice a percentage of its population!
attributes.additional_details:
UK Government should treat us as people not numbers! Each individual that can be saved is UK citizen or resident that pays taxes and individually contributes to UK economy and health care.
It is our HUMAN RIGHT to access the health care system we pay for. I want to have access to professional advice and care from day 1 of symptoms. I want UK to care for its people, each of them regardless of age! Others countries can do it, can fight for each of their people, why can't you UK?
attributes.background:
UK prides with NHS but we cannot access it for coronavirus! We cannot call 111 even if we have Covid-19 symptoms and there is no advice on 
what medicine to use if needed, probably we all should know it's PARACETAMOL. Only after 7 days we are allowed to call 111!
Why MPs ca be tested and I cannot?

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action. 

We're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do.  
The conduct of tests is a clinical decision for the NHS, not the UK Government or Parliament. You might want to know that the Government has set out that 'herd immunity' is not a strategy. You can read a recent comment by the Health Secretary here:

https://hansard.parliament.uk/Commons/2020-03-16/debates/235689EC-0A18-4488-BFCF-9F012A1A0C1B/Covid-19#contribution-4215E975-1483-4CB0-A03B-1F67E4E9B990

We have published a petition calling for the Government to provide publicly accessible testing for coronavirus around the UK, which you might want to sign: 
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/301354 

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do. 

You can find out more about coronavirus and how you can protect yourself and others here: 

NHS website: https://www.nhs.uk/conditions/coronavirus-covid-19/ 

UK Government website: https://www.gov.uk/guidance/coronavirus-covid-19-information-for-the-public
